alert.note: Alert for Marion; Marshall; Monongalia; Preston; Wetzel (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 3:53AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Portions of east central Ohio, including the following counties, Guernsey, Monroe and Noble. Portions of southwest Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Fayette and Greene. Portions of West Virginia, including the following counties, Marion, Marshall, Monongalia, Preston and Wetzel. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 353 AM EST, gauge reports indicated an area of very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Rapid snowmelt is also occurring and will add to the flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Morgantown, Fairmont, New Martinsville, Westover, Woodsfield, Mannington, Star City, Caldwell, Pleasant Valley, Winfield, Barrackville, Point Marion, Monongah, Granville, Pine Grove, Fairview, Hundred, Jacksonburg, Cassville and Brookhaven. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
